gistit(filename, jist='/usr/local/bin/jist', type='notebook')[source]¶

use the jist utility to paste a txt file on github as gist and return a link to it

>>> gistit(notebookfile)
Parameters:
  • filename (str) – path to the a text file or notebook file (.json)
  • jist (str) – path to the executable jist (default=/usr/local/bin/jist)
  • type (str) – notebook, text
Returns:

link to gist if type=text, link to nbviewer if type=notebook
Return type:

str

  • notebookdir –
uploadfile(username='epi', password='epi', hostname='localhost', port=22, inputfile=None, outputfile=None, link=False, apacheroot='/var/www/', zip=False, qr=False)[source]¶

Utility function to upload file on remote server using sftp protocol

>>> uploadfile(inputfile, outputfile)
Parameters:
  • username (str) – username on remote server
  • password (str) – password to access remote server
  • hostname (str) – hostname of remote server (default: localhost)
  • port (int) – port number on remote server (default: 22)
  • inputfile (str) – local path to the file to uploaded
  • outputfile (str) – remote path to the file to upload
  • link (str) – bolean [True, False] default False, print a link to download the file (remote path needs to be in a web available directory)
  • apacheroot (str) – path to apache root default to ‘/var/www/’ required if link == True
  • zip (str) – deafault False, zip the output
  • qr (str) – deafault False, return qrcode as image
Returns:

link to uploaded file if link=True or qr image if qr=True & link=True, none if link is set to false
Return type:

str
which(program)[source]¶

Check if a program exist and return the full path

Parameters:program (str) – executable name or path to executable
Returns:full path to executable
Return type:str
zipdir(basedir, archivename, rm='no')[source]¶

Utility function to zip a single file or a directory

>>> zipdir(input, output)
Parameters:
  • basedir – input file or directory
  • archivename – output file.zip
  • rm – [yes, no], remove source file (optional, default=no)
